2759  }
2760 
2761  // Apex Predators don't think about much other than killing.
2762  // They don't lose Focus when practicing combat skills.
2763  if( !( has_flag( json_flag_PRED4 ) && skill.is_combat_skill() ) ) {
2764  // Base reduction on the larger of 1% of total, or practice amount.
2765  // The latter kicks in when long actions like crafting
2766  // apply many turns of gains at once.
2767  int focus_drain = std::max( focus_pool / 100, amount );
2768 
2769  // The purpose of having this squared is that it makes focus drain dramatically slower
2770  // as it approaches zero. As such, the square function would not be used if the drain is
2771  // larger or equal to 1000 to avoid the runaway, and the original drain gets applied instead.
2772  if( focus_drain >= 1000 ) {
2773  focus_pool -= focus_drain;
2774  } else {
2775  focus_pool -= ( focus_drain * focus_drain ) / 1000;
2776  }
2777  }
2778  focus_pool = std::max( focus_pool, 0 );
2779  }
2780 
2781  get_skill_level_object( id ).practice();
2782  return level_up;
2783 }
2784 
2785 // Returned values range from 1.0 (unimpeded vision) to 11.0 (totally blind).
2786 // 1.0 is LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT or brighter
2787 // 4.0 is a dark clear night, barely bright enough for reading and crafting
2788 // 6.0 is LIGHT_AMBIENT_DIM
2789 // 7.3 is LIGHT_AMBIENT_MINIMAL, a dark cloudy night, unlit indoors
2790 // 11.0 is zero light or blindness
2791 float Character::fine_detail_vision_mod( const tripoint &p ) const
2792 {
2793  // PER_SLIME_OK implies you can get enough eyes around the bile
2794  // that you can generally see. There still will be the haze, but
2795  // it's annoying rather than limiting.
2796  if( is_blind() ||
2797  ( ( has_effect( effect_boomered ) || has_effect( effect_darkness ) ) &&
2798  !has_trait( trait_PER_SLIME_OK ) ) ) {
2799  return 11.0;
2800  }
2801  // Scale linearly as light level approaches LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT.
2802  // If we're actually a source of light, assume we can direct it where we need it.
2803  // Therefore give a hefty bonus relative to ambient light.
2804  float own_light = std::max( 1.0f, LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT - active_light() - 2.0f );
2805 
2806  // Same calculation as above, but with a result 3 lower.
2807  float ambient_light{};
2808  tripoint const check_p = p == tripoint_min ? pos() : p;
2809  tripoint const avatar_p = get_avatar().pos();
2810  if( is_avatar() || check_p.z == avatar_p.z ) {
2811  ambient_light = std::max( 1.0f,
2812  LIGHT_AMBIENT_LIT - get_map().ambient_light_at( check_p ) + 1.0f );
2813  } else {
2814  // light map is not calculated outside the player character's z-level
2815  // even if fov_3d_z_range > 0, and building light map on multiple levels
2816  // could be expensive, so make NPCs able to see things in this case to
2817  // not interfere with NPC activity.
2818  ambient_light = 1.0f;
2819  }
2820 
2821  return std::min( own_light, ambient_light );
2822 }
2823 
2824 units::energy Character::get_power_level() const
2825 {
2826  return power_level;
2827 }
2828 
2829 units::energy Character::get_max_power_level() const
2830 {
2831  units::energy val = enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::BIONIC_POWER,
2832  max_power_level_cached + max_power_level_modifier );
2833  return clamp( val, 0_kJ, units::energy_max );
2834 }
2835 
2836 void Character::set_power_level( const units::energy &npower )
2837 {
2838  power_level = clamp( npower, 0_kJ, get_max_power_level() );
2839 }
2840 
2841 void Character::set_max_power_level_modifier( const units::energy &capacity )
2842 {
2843  max_power_level_modifier = clamp( capacity, units::energy_min, units::energy_max );
2844 }
2845 
2846 void Character::set_max_power_level( const units::energy &capacity )
2847 {
2848  max_power_level_modifier = clamp( capacity - max_power_level_cached, units::energy_min,
2849  units::energy_max );
2850 }
2851 
2852 void Character::mod_power_level( const units::energy &npower )
2853 {
2854  set_power_level( power_level + npower );
2855  if( npower < 0_kJ && !has_power() ) {
2856  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
2857  if( !bp->no_power_effect.is_null() ) {
2858  add_effect( bp->no_power_effect, 5_turns );
2859  }
2860  }
2861  }
2862 }
2863 
2864 void Character::mod_max_power_level_modifier( const units::energy &npower )
2865 {
2866  max_power_level_modifier = clamp( max_power_level_modifier + npower, units::energy_min,
2867  units::energy_max );
2868 }
2869 
2870 bool Character::is_max_power() const
2871 {
2872  return get_power_level() >= get_max_power_level();
2873 }
2874 
2875 bool Character::has_power() const
2876 {
2877  return get_power_level() > 0_kJ;
2878 }
2879 
2880 bool Character::has_max_power() const
2881 {
2882  return get_max_power_level() > 0_kJ;
2883 }
2884 
2885 bool Character::enough_power_for( const bionic_id &bid ) const
2886 {
2887  return get_power_level() >= bid->power_activate;
2888 }
2889 
2890 std::vector<skill_id> Character::skills_offered_to( const Character *you ) const
2891 {
2892  std::vector<skill_id> ret;
2893  for( const auto &pair : *_skills ) {
2894  const skill_id &id = pair.first;
2895  if( id->is_teachable() && pair.second.level() > 0 &&
2896  ( !you || you->get_knowledge_level( id ) < pair.second.level() ) ) {
2897  ret.push_back( id );
2898  }
2899  }
2900  return ret;
2901 }
2902 
2903 std::vector<matype_id> Character::styles_offered_to( const Character *you ) const
2904 {
2905  if( you ) {
2906  return you->martial_arts_data->get_unknown_styles( *martial_arts_data, true );
2907  }
2908  return martial_arts_data->get_known_styles( true );
2909 }
2910 
2911 std::vector<spell_id> Character::spells_offered_to( const Character *you ) const
2912 {
2913  std::vector<spell_id> teachable;
2914  for( const spell_id &sp : magic->spells() ) {
2915  const spell &teacher_spell = magic->get_spell( sp );
2916  if( sp->teachable && ( !you || you->magic->can_learn_spell( *you, sp ) ) ) {
2917  if( you && you->magic->knows_spell( sp ) ) {
2918  const spell &student_spell = you->magic->get_spell( sp );
2919  if( student_spell.is_max_level( *you ) ||
2920  student_spell.get_level() >= teacher_spell.get_level() ) {
2921  continue;
2922  }
2923  }
2924  teachable.emplace_back( sp );
2925  }
2926  }
2927  return teachable;
2928 }
2929 
2930 void Character::conduct_blood_analysis()
2931 {
2932  std::vector<std::string> effect_descriptions;
2933  std::vector<nc_color> colors;
2934 
2935  for( auto &elem : *effects ) {
2936  if( elem.first->get_blood_analysis_description().empty() ) {
2937  continue;
2938  }
2939  effect_descriptions.emplace_back( elem.first->get_blood_analysis_description() );
2940  colors.emplace_back( elem.first->get_rating() == m_good ? c_green : c_red );
2941  }
2942 
2943  const int win_w = 46;
2944  size_t win_h = 0;
2945  catacurses::window w;
2946  ui_adaptor ui;
2947  ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
2948  win_h = std::min( static_cast<size_t>( TERMY ),
2949  std::max<size_t>( 1, effect_descriptions.size() ) + 2 );
2950  w = catacurses::newwin( win_h, win_w,
2951  point( ( TERMX - win_w ) / 2, ( TERMY - win_h ) / 2 ) );
2952  ui.position_from_window( w );
2953  } );
2954  ui.mark_resize();
2955  ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
2956  draw_border( w, c_red, string_format( " %s ", _( "Blood Test Results" ) ) );
2957  if( effect_descriptions.empty() ) {
2958  trim_and_print( w, point( 2, 1 ), win_w - 3, c_white, _( "No effects." ) );
2959  } else {
2960  for( size_t line = 1; line < ( win_h - 1 ) && line <= effect_descriptions.size(); ++line ) {
2961  trim_and_print( w, point( 2, line ), win_w - 3, colors[line - 1], effect_descriptions[line - 1] );
2962  }
2963  }
2964  wnoutrefresh( w );
2965  } );
2966  input_context ctxt( "BLOOD_TEST_RESULTS" );
2967  ctxt.register_action( "CONFIRM" );
2968  ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
2969  ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
2970  bool stop = false;
2971  // Display new messages
2972  g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
2973  while( !stop ) {
2974  ui_manager::redraw();
2975  const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
2976  if( action == "CONFIRM" || action == "QUIT" ) {
2977  stop = true;
2978  }
2979  }
2980 }
2981 
2982 int Character::get_standard_stamina_cost( const item *thrown_item ) const
2983 {
2984  // Previously calculated as 2_gram * std::max( 1, str_cur )
2985  // using 16_gram normalizes it to 8 str. Same effort expenditure
2986  // for each strike, regardless of weight. This is compensated
2987  // for by the additional move cost as weapon weight increases
2988  //If the item is thrown, override with the thrown item instead.
2989 
2990  item current_weapon = used_weapon() ? *used_weapon() : null_item_reference();
2991 
2992  const int weight_cost = ( thrown_item == nullptr ) ? current_weapon.weight() /
2993  16_gram : thrown_item->weight() / 16_gram;
2994  return ( weight_cost + 50 ) * -1 * get_modifier( character_modifier_melee_stamina_cost_mod );
2995 }
2996 
2997 std::vector<item_location> Character::nearby( const
2998  std::function<bool( const item *, const item * )> &func, int radius ) const
2999 {
3000  std::vector<item_location> res;
3001 
3002  visit_items( [&]( const item * e, const item * parent ) {
3003  if( func( e, parent ) ) {
3004  res.emplace_back( const_cast<Character &>( *this ), const_cast<item *>( e ) );
3005  }
3006  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
3007  } );
3008 
3009  for( const map_cursor &cur : map_selector( pos(), radius ) ) {
3010  cur.visit_items( [&]( const item * e, const item * parent ) {
3011  if( func( e, parent ) ) {
3012  res.emplace_back( cur, const_cast<item *>( e ) );
3013  }
3014  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
3015  } );
3016  }
3017 
3018  for( const vehicle_cursor &cur : vehicle_selector( pos(), radius ) ) {
3019  cur.visit_items( [&]( const item * e, const item * parent ) {
3020  if( func( e, parent ) ) {
3021  res.emplace_back( cur, const_cast<item *>( e ) );
3022  }
3023  return VisitResponse::NEXT;
3024  } );
3025  }
3026 
3027  return res;
3028 }
3029 
3030 std::list<item> Character::remove_worn_items_with( const std::function<bool( item & )> &filter )
3031 {
3032  invalidate_inventory_validity_cache();
3033  invalidate_leak_level_cache();
3034  return worn.remove_worn_items_with( filter, *this );
3035 }
3036 
3037 void Character::clear_worn()
3038 {
3039  worn.worn.clear();
3040  inv_search_caches.clear();
3041 }
3042 
3043 std::list<item *> Character::get_dependent_worn_items( const item &it )
3044 {
3045  std::list<item *> dependent;
3046 
3047  if( is_worn( it ) ) {
3048  worn.add_dependent_item( dependent, it );
3049  }
3050 
3051  return dependent;
3052 }
3053 
3054 item Character::remove_weapon()
3055 {
3056  item tmp = weapon;
3057  weapon = item();
3058  get_event_bus().send<event_type::character_wields_item>( getID(), weapon.typeId() );
3059  cached_info.erase( "weapon_value" );
3060  invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
3061  return tmp;
3062 }
3063 
3064 void Character::remove_mission_items( int mission_id )
3065 {
3066  if( mission_id == -1 ) {
3067  return;
3068  }
3069  remove_items_with( has_mission_item_filter { mission_id } );
3070 }
3071 
3072 void Character::on_move( const tripoint_abs_ms &old_pos )
3073 {
3074  Creature::on_move( old_pos );
3075  // Ugly to compare a tripoint_bub_ms with a tripoint_abs_ms, but the 'z' component
3076  // is the same regardless of the x/y reference point.
3077  if( this->pos_bub().z() != old_pos.z() ) {
3078  // Make sure caches are rebuilt in a timely manner to ensure companions aren't
3079  // caught in the "dark" because the caches aren't updated on their next move.
3080  get_map().build_map_cache( this->pos_bub().z() );
3081  }
3082  // In case we've moved out of range of lifting assist.
3083  if( using_lifting_assist ) {
3084  invalidate_weight_carried_cache();
3085  }
3086 }
3087 
3088 units::mass Character::weight_carried() const
3089 {
3090  if( cached_weight_carried ) {
3091  return *cached_weight_carried;
3092  }
3093  cached_weight_carried = weight_carried_with_tweaks( item_tweaks() );
3094  return *cached_weight_carried;
3095 }
3096 
3097 void Character::invalidate_weight_carried_cache()
3098 {
3099  cached_weight_carried = std::nullopt;
3100 }
3101 
3102 units::mass Character::best_nearby_lifting_assist() const
3103 {
3104  return best_nearby_lifting_assist( this->pos() );
3105 }
3106 
3107 units::mass Character::best_nearby_lifting_assist( const tripoint &world_pos ) const
3108 {
3109  int mech_lift = 0;
3110  if( is_mounted() ) {
3111  auto *mons = mounted_creature.get();
3112  if( mons->has_flag( mon_flag_RIDEABLE_MECH ) ) {
3113  mech_lift = mons->mech_str_addition() + 10;
3114  }
3115  }
3116  int lift_quality = std::max( { this->max_quality( qual_LIFT ), mech_lift,
3117  map_selector( this->pos(), PICKUP_RANGE ).max_quality( qual_LIFT ),
3118  vehicle_selector( world_pos, 4, true, true ).max_quality( qual_LIFT )
3119  } );
3120  return lifting_quality_to_mass( lift_quality );
3121 }
3122 
3123 units::mass Character::weight_carried_with_tweaks( const std::vector<std::pair<item_location, int>>
3124  &locations ) const
3125 {
3126  std::map<const item *, int> dropping;
3127  for( const std::pair<item_location, int> &location_pair : locations ) {
3128  dropping.emplace( location_pair.first.get_item(), location_pair.second );
3129  }
3130  return weight_carried_with_tweaks( item_tweaks( { dropping } ) );
3131 }
3132 
3133 units::mass Character::weight_carried_with_tweaks( const item_tweaks &tweaks ) const
3134 {
3135  const std::map<const item *, int> empty;
3136  const std::map<const item *, int> &without = tweaks.without_items ? tweaks.without_items->get() :
3137  empty;
3138 
3139  // Worn items
3140  units::mass ret = worn.weight_carried_with_tweaks( without );
3141 
3142  // Wielded item
3143  units::mass weaponweight = 0_gram;
3144  if( !without.count( &weapon ) ) {
3145  weaponweight += weapon.weight();
3146  for( const item *i : weapon.all_items_ptr( pocket_type::CONTAINER ) ) {
3147  if( i->count_by_charges() ) {
3148  weaponweight -= get_selected_stack_weight( i, without );
3149  } else if( without.count( i ) ) {
3150  weaponweight -= i->weight();
3151  }
3152  }
3153  } else if( weapon.count_by_charges() ) {
3154  weaponweight += weapon.weight() - get_selected_stack_weight( &weapon, without );
3155  }
3156 
3157  // Exclude wielded item if using lifting tool
3158  if( ( weaponweight + ret <= weight_capacity() ) || ( g->new_game ||
3159  best_nearby_lifting_assist() < weaponweight ) ) {
3160  ret += weaponweight;
3161  using_lifting_assist = false;
3162  } else {
3163  using_lifting_assist = true;
3164  }
3165 
3166  return ret;
3167 }
3168 
3169 units::volume Character::volume_carried_with_tweaks( const
3170  std::vector<std::pair<item_location, int>>
3171  &locations ) const
3172 {
3173  std::map<const item *, int> dropping;
3174  for( const std::pair<item_location, int> &location_pair : locations ) {
3175  dropping.emplace( location_pair.first.get_item(), location_pair.second );
3176  }
3177  return volume_carried_with_tweaks( item_tweaks( { dropping } ) );
3178 }
3179 
3180 units::volume Character::volume_carried_with_tweaks( const item_tweaks &tweaks ) const
3181 {
3182  const std::map<const item *, int> empty;
3183  const std::map<const item *, int> &without = tweaks.without_items ? tweaks.without_items->get() :
3184  empty;
3185 
3186  // Worn items
3187  units::volume ret = worn.contents_volume_with_tweaks( without );
3188 
3189  // Wielded item
3190  if( !without.count( &weapon ) ) {
3191  ret += weapon.get_contents_volume_with_tweaks( without );
3192  }
3193 
3194  return ret;
3195 }
3196 
3197 units::mass Character::weight_capacity() const
3198 {
3199  // Get base capacity from creature,
3200  // then apply enchantment.
3201  units::mass ret = Creature::weight_capacity();
3202  // Not using get_str() so pain and other temporary effects won't decrease carrying capacity;
3203  // transiently reducing carry weight is unlikely to have any play impact besides being very annoying.
3204  /** @EFFECT_STR increases carrying capacity */
3205  ret += ( get_str_base() + get_str_bonus() ) * 4_kilogram;
3206 
3207  ret = enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::CARRY_WEIGHT, ret );
3208 
3209  if( ret < 0_gram ) {
3210  ret = 0_gram;
3211  }
3212  if( is_mounted() ) {
3213  auto *mons = mounted_creature.get();
3214  // the mech has an effective strength for other purposes, like hitting.
3215  // but for lifting, its effective strength is even higher, due to its sturdy construction, leverage,
3216  // and being built entirely for that purpose with hydraulics etc.
3217  ret = mons->mech_str_addition() == 0 ? ret : ( mons->mech_str_addition() + 10 ) * 4_kilogram;
3218  }
3219  return ret;
3220 }
3221 
3222 bool Character::can_pickVolume( const item &it, bool, const item *avoid,
3223  const bool ignore_pkt_settings ) const
3224 {
3225  if( ( avoid == nullptr || &weapon != avoid ) &&
3226  weapon.can_contain( it, false, false, ignore_pkt_settings ).success() ) {
3227  return true;
3228  }
3229  if( worn.can_pickVolume( it, ignore_pkt_settings ) ) {
3230  return true;
3231  }
3232  return false;
3233 }
3234 
3235 bool Character::can_pickVolume_partial( const item &it, bool, const item *avoid,
3236  const bool ignore_pkt_settings, const bool is_pick_up_inv ) const
3237 {
3238  item copy = it;
3239  if( it.count_by_charges() ) {
3240  copy.charges = 1;
3241  }
3242 
3243  if( ( avoid == nullptr || &weapon != avoid ) &&
3244  weapon.can_contain( copy, false, false, ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv ).success() ) {
3245  return true;
3246  }
3247 
3248  return worn.can_pickVolume( copy, ignore_pkt_settings, is_pick_up_inv );
3249 }
3250 
3251 bool Character::can_pickWeight( const item &it, bool safe ) const
3252 {
3253  if( !safe ) {
3254  // Character can carry up to four times their maximum weight
3255  return ( weight_carried() + it.weight() <= weight_capacity() * 4 );
3256  } else {
3257  return ( weight_carried() + it.weight() <= weight_capacity() );
3258  }
3259 }
3260 
3261 bool Character::can_pickWeight_partial( const item &it, bool safe ) const
3262 {
3263  item copy = it;
3264  if( it.count_by_charges() ) {
3265  copy.charges = 1;
3266  }
3267 
3268  return can_pickWeight( copy, safe );
3269 }
3270 
3271 bool Character::can_use( const item &it, const item &context ) const
3272 {
3273  if( has_effect( effect_incorporeal ) ) {
3274  add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "You can't use anything while incorporeal." ),
3275  _( "<npcname> can't use anything while incorporeal." ) );
3276  return false;
3277  }
3278  const item &ctx = !context.is_null() ? context : it;
3279 
3280  if( !meets_requirements( it, ctx ) ) {
3281  const std::string unmet( enumerate_unmet_requirements( it, ctx ) );
3282 
3283  if( &it == &ctx ) {
3284  //~ %1$s - list of unmet requirements, %2$s - item name.
3285  add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "You need at least %1$s to use this %2$s." ),
3286  _( "<npcname> needs at least %1$s to use this %2$s." ),
3287  unmet, it.tname() );
3288  } else {
3289  //~ %1$s - list of unmet requirements, %2$s - item name, %3$s - indirect item name.
3290  add_msg_player_or_npc( m_bad, _( "You need at least %1$s to use this %2$s with your %3$s." ),
3291  _( "<npcname> needs at least %1$s to use this %2$s with their %3$s." ),
3292  unmet, it.tname(), ctx.tname() );
3293  }
3294 
3295  return false;
3296  }
3297 
3298  return true;
3299 }
3300 
3301 ret_val<void> Character::can_unwield( const item &it ) const
3302 {
3303  if( it.has_flag( flag_NO_UNWIELD ) ) {
3304  // check if "it" is currently wielded fake bionic weapon that can be deactivated
3305  std::optional<bionic *> bio_opt = find_bionic_by_uid( get_weapon_bionic_uid() );
3306  if( !is_wielding( it ) || it.ethereal || !bio_opt ||
3307  !can_deactivate_bionic( **bio_opt ).success() ) {
3308  return ret_val<void>::make_failure( _( "You cannot unwield your %s." ), it.tname() );
3309  }
3310  }
3311 
3312  return ret_val<void>::make_success();
3313 }
3314 
3315 void Character::invalidate_inventory_validity_cache()
3316 {
3317  cache_inventory_is_valid = false;
3318 }
3319 bool Character::is_wielding( const item &target ) const
3320 {
3321  return &weapon == &target;
3322 }
3323 
3324 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> Character::get_overlay_ids() const
3325 {
3326  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> rval;
3327  std::multimap<int, std::pair<std::string, std::string>> mutation_sorting;
3328  int order;
3329  std::string overlay_id;
3330  std::string variant;
3331 
3332  // first get effects
3333  for( const auto &eff_pr : *effects ) {
3334  rval.emplace_back( "effect_" + eff_pr.first.str(), "" );
3335  }
3336 
3337  // then get mutations
3338  const std::vector<trait_id> &all_mutations = get_mutations();
3339  for( const trait_id &mut : all_mutations ) {
3340  // get the data if it exists
3341  const auto mut_data = my_mutations.find( mut );
3342  if( mut_data == my_mutations.end() ) {
3343  // this entry is from an enchantment and doesn't have any character dependent info
3344  overlay_id = mut.str();
3345 
3346  } else {
3347  if( !mut_data->second.show_sprite ) {
3348  continue;
3349  }
3350  overlay_id = ( mut_data->second.powered ? "active_" : "" ) + mut.str();
3351  if( mut_data->second.variant != nullptr ) {
3352  variant = mut_data->second.variant->id;
3353  }
3354  }
3355  order = get_overlay_order_of_mutation( overlay_id );
3356  mutation_sorting.emplace( order, std::pair<std::string, std::string> { overlay_id, variant } );
3357  }
3358 
3359  // then get bionics
3360  for( const bionic &bio : *my_bionics ) {
3361  if( !bio.show_sprite ) {
3362  continue;
3363  }
3364  overlay_id = ( bio.powered ? "active_" : "" ) + bio.id.str();
3365  order = get_overlay_order_of_mutation( overlay_id );
3366  mutation_sorting.emplace( order, std::pair<std::string, std::string> { overlay_id, "" } );
3367  }
3368 
3369  for( auto &mutorder : mutation_sorting ) {
3370  rval.emplace_back( "mutation_" + mutorder.second.first, mutorder.second.second );
3371  }
3372 
3373  // next clothing
3374  worn.get_overlay_ids( rval );
3375 
3376  // last weapon
3377  // TODO: might there be clothing that covers the weapon?
3378  if( is_armed() ) {
3379  const std::string variant = weapon.has_itype_variant() ? weapon.itype_variant().id : "";
3380  rval.emplace_back( "wielded_" + weapon.typeId().str(), variant );
3381  }
3382 
3383  if( !is_walking() ) {
3384  rval.emplace_back( move_mode.str(), "" );
3385  }
3386 
3387  return rval;
3388 }
3389 
3390 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> Character::get_overlay_ids_when_override_look()
3391  const
3392 {
3393  std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> rval;
3394  std::multimap<int, std::pair<std::string, std::string>> mutation_sorting;
3395  std::string overlay_id;
3396  std::string variant;
3397 
3398  // first get effects
3399  for( const auto &eff_pr : *effects ) {
3400  rval.emplace_back( "effect_" + eff_pr.first.str(), "" );
3401  }
3402  // then move_move sign
3403  if( !is_walking() ) {
3404  rval.emplace_back( move_mode.str(), "" );
3405  }
3406  return rval;
3407 }
3408 
3409 SkillLevelMap Character::get_all_skills() const
3410 {
3411  SkillLevelMap skills = *_skills;
3412  for( std::pair<const skill_id, SkillLevel> &sk : skills ) {
3413  sk.second.level( std::round( enchantment_cache->modify_value( sk.first, sk.second.level() ) ) );
3414  }
3415  return skills;
3416 }
3417 
3418 const SkillLevel &Character::get_skill_level_object( const skill_id &ident ) const
3419 {
3420  return _skills->get_skill_level_object( ident );
3421 }
3422 
3423 SkillLevel &Character::get_skill_level_object( const skill_id &ident )
3424 {
3425  return _skills->get_skill_level_object( ident );
3426 }
3427 
3428 float Character::get_skill_level( const skill_id &ident ) const
3429 {
3430  return enchantment_cache->modify_value( ident,
3431  _skills->get_skill_level( ident ) + _skills->get_progress_level( ident ) );
3432 }
3433 
3434 float Character::get_skill_level( const skill_id &ident, const item &context ) const
3435 {
3436  return enchantment_cache->modify_value( ident, _skills->get_skill_level( ident,
3437  context ) + _skills->get_progress_level( ident,
3438  context ) );
3439 }
3440 
3441 int Character::get_knowledge_level( const skill_id &ident ) const
3442 {
3443  return _skills->get_knowledge_level( ident );
3444 }
3445 
3446 float Character::get_knowledge_plus_progress( const skill_id &ident ) const
3447 {
3448  return _skills->get_knowledge_level( ident ) + _skills->get_knowledge_progress_level( ident );
3449 }
3450 
3451 int Character::get_knowledge_level( const skill_id &ident, const item &context ) const
3452 {
3453  return _skills->get_knowledge_level( ident, context );
3454 }
3455 
3456 float Character::get_average_skill_level( const skill_id &ident ) const
3457 {
3458  return ( get_skill_level( ident ) + get_knowledge_plus_progress( ident ) ) / 2;
3459 }
3460 
3461 float Character::get_greater_skill_or_knowledge_level( const skill_id &ident ) const
3462 {
3463  return get_skill_level( ident ) > get_knowledge_plus_progress( ident ) ? get_skill_level(
3464  ident ) : get_knowledge_plus_progress( ident );
3465 }
3466 
3467 void Character::set_skill_level( const skill_id &ident, const int level )
3468 {
3469  get_skill_level_object( ident ).level( level );
3470 }
3471 
3472 void Character::mod_skill_level( const skill_id &ident, const int delta )
3473 {
3474  _skills->mod_skill_level( ident, delta );
3475 }
3476 void Character::set_knowledge_level( const skill_id &ident, const int level )
3477 {
3478  get_skill_level_object( ident ).knowledgeLevel( level );
3479 }
3480 
3481 void Character::mod_knowledge_level( const skill_id &ident, const int delta )
3482 {
3483  _skills->mod_knowledge_level( ident, delta );
3484 }
3485 
3486 std::string Character::enumerate_unmet_requirements( const item &it, const item &context ) const
3487 {
3488  std::vector<std::string> unmet_reqs;
3489 
3490  const auto check_req = [ &unmet_reqs ]( const std::string & name, int cur, int req ) {
3491  if( cur < req ) {
3492  unmet_reqs.push_back( string_format( "%s %d", name, req ) );
3493  }
3494  };
3495 
3496  check_req( _( "strength" ), get_str(), it.get_min_str() );
3497  check_req( _( "dexterity" ), get_dex(), it.type->min_dex );
3498  check_req( _( "intelligence" ), get_int(), it.type->min_int );
3499  check_req( _( "perception" ), get_per(), it.type->min_per );
3500 
3501  for( const auto &elem : it.type->min_skills ) {
3502  check_req( context.contextualize_skill( elem.first )->name(),
3503  static_cast<int>( get_skill_level( elem.first, context ) ),
3504  elem.second );
3505  }
3506 
3507  return enumerate_as_string( unmet_reqs );
3508 }
3509 
3510 int Character::read_speed() const
3511 {
3512  // Stat window shows stat effects on based on current stat
3513  const float intel = 2.0f + get_int() / 8.0f;
3514  // 4 int = 72 seconds, 8 int = 60 seconds, 12 int = 51 seconds, 16 int = 45 seconds, 20 int = 40 seconds
3515  /** @EFFECT_INT affects reading speed by an decreasing amount the higher intelligence goes, intially about 9% per point at 4 int to lower than 4% at 20+ int */
3516  time_duration ret = 180_seconds / intel;
3517 
3518  ret = enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::READING_SPEED_MULTIPLIER, ret );
3519  if( ret < 1_seconds ) {
3520  ret = 1_seconds;
3521  }
3522  return ret * 100 / 1_minutes;
3523 }
3524 
3525 bool Character::meets_skill_requirements( const std::map<skill_id, int> &req,
3526  const item &context ) const
3527 {
3528  return _skills->meets_skill_requirements( req, context );
3529 }
3530 
3531 bool Character::meets_skill_requirements( const construction &con ) const
3532 {
3533  return std::all_of( con.required_skills.begin(), con.required_skills.end(),
3534  [&]( const std::pair<skill_id, int> &pr ) {
3535  return get_knowledge_level( pr.first ) >= pr.second;
3536  } );
3537 }
3538 
3539 bool Character::meets_stat_requirements( const item &it ) const
3540 {
3541  return get_str() >= it.get_min_str() &&
3542  get_dex() >= it.type->min_dex &&
3543  get_int() >= it.type->min_int &&
3544  get_per() >= it.type->min_per;
3545 }
3546 
3547 bool Character::meets_requirements( const item &it, const item &context ) const
3548 {
3549  const item &ctx = !context.is_null() ? context : it;
3550  return meets_stat_requirements( it ) && meets_skill_requirements( it.type->min_skills, ctx );
3551 }
3552 
3553 void Character::normalize()
3554 {
3555  Creature::normalize();
3556 
3557  activity_history.weary_clear();
3558  martial_arts_data->reset_style();
3559  weapon = item( "null", calendar::turn_zero );
3560 
3561  set_body();
3562  recalc_hp();
3563  set_all_parts_temp_conv( BODYTEMP_NORM );
3564  set_stamina( get_stamina_max() );
3565  oxygen = get_oxygen_max();
3566 }
3567 
3568 // Actual player death is mostly handled in game::is_game_over
3569 void Character::die( Creature *nkiller )
3570 {
3571  g->set_critter_died();
3572  set_all_parts_hp_cur( 0 );
3573  set_killer( nkiller );
3574  set_time_died( calendar::turn );
3575 
3576  if( has_effect( effect_heavysnare ) ) {
3577  inv->add_item( item( "rope_6", calendar::turn_zero ) );
3578  inv->add_item( item( "snare_trigger", calendar::turn_zero ) );
3579  }
3580  if( has_effect( effect_beartrap ) ) {
3581  inv->add_item( item( "beartrap", calendar::turn_zero ) );
3582  }
3583  mission::on_creature_death( *this );
3584 }
3585 
3586 void Character::prevent_death()
3587 {
3588  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts( get_body_part_flags::only_main ) ) {
3589  if( bp->is_vital ) {
3590  if( get_part_hp_cur( bp ) <= 0 ) {
3591  set_part_hp_cur( bp, 1 );
3592  }
3593  }
3594  }
3595  cached_dead_state.reset();
3596 }
3597 
3598 void Character::apply_skill_boost()
3599 {
3600  for( const skill_boost &boost : skill_boost::get_all() ) {
3601  float skill_total = 0;
3602  for( const std::string &skill_str : boost.skills() ) {
3603  skill_total += get_skill_level( skill_id( skill_str ) );
3604  }
3605  mod_stat( boost.stat(), boost.calc_bonus( skill_total ) );
3606  if( boost.stat() == "str" ) {
3607  recalc_hp();
3608  }
3609  }
3610 }
3611 
3612 std::pair<bodypart_id, int> Character::best_part_to_smash() const
3613 {
3614  const bodypart_id bp_null( "bp_null" );
3615  std::pair<bodypart_id, int> best_part_to_smash = {bp_null, 0};
3616  int tmp_bash_armor = 0;
3617  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
3618  tmp_bash_armor += worn.damage_resist( damage_bash, bp );
3619  for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
3620  const resistances &res = mut->damage_resistance( bp );
3621  tmp_bash_armor += std::floor( res.type_resist( damage_bash ) );
3622  }
3623  if( tmp_bash_armor > best_part_to_smash.second ) {
3624  best_part_to_smash = {bp, tmp_bash_armor};
3625  }
3626  }
3627 
3628  return best_part_to_smash;
3629 }
3630 
3631 int Character::smash_ability() const
3632 {
3633  int ret = get_arm_str();
3634  ///\EFFECT_STR increases smashing capability
3635  if( is_mounted() ) {
3636  auto *mon = mounted_creature.get();
3637  ret += mon->mech_str_addition() + mon->type->melee_dice * mon->type->melee_sides;
3638  } else if( get_wielded_item() ) {
3639  ret += get_wielded_item()->damage_melee( damage_bash );
3640  ret = calculate_by_enchantment( ret, enchant_vals::mod::ITEM_DAMAGE_BASH, true );
3641  }
3642 
3643  if( !has_weapon() ) {
3644  std::pair<bodypart_id, int> best_part = best_part_to_smash();
3645  const int min_ret = ret * best_part.first->smash_efficiency;
3646  const int max_ret = ret * ( 1.0f + best_part.first->smash_efficiency );
3647  ret = std::min( best_part.second + min_ret, max_ret );
3648  }
3649  ret = calculate_by_enchantment( ret, enchant_vals::mod::MELEE_DAMAGE, true );
3650 
3651  return ret;
3652 }
3653 
3654 void Character::do_skill_rust()
3655 {
3656  for( std::pair<const skill_id, SkillLevel> &pair : *_skills ) {
3657  const Skill &aSkill = *pair.first;
3658  SkillLevel &skill_level_obj = pair.second;
3659 
3660  if( aSkill.is_combat_skill() &&
3661  ( ( has_flag( json_flag_PRED2 ) && calendar::once_every( 8_hours ) ) ||
3662  ( has_flag( json_flag_PRED3 ) && calendar::once_every( 4_hours ) ) ||
3663  ( has_flag( json_flag_PRED4 ) && calendar::once_every( 3_hours ) ) ) ) {
3664  // Their brain is optimized to remember this
3665  if( one_in( 13 ) ) {
3666  // They've already passed the roll to avoid rust at
3667  // this point, but print a message about it now and
3668  // then.
3669  //
3670  // 13 combat skills.
3671  // This means PRED2/PRED3/PRED4 think of hunting on
3672  // average every 8/4/3 hours, enough for immersion
3673  // without becoming an annoyance.
3674  //
3675  add_msg_if_player( _( "Your heart races as you recall your most recent hunt." ) );
3676  mod_stim( 1 );
3677  }
3678  continue;
3679  }
3680 
3681  const int rust_resist = enchantment_cache->get_value_add( enchant_vals::mod::SKILL_RUST_RESIST );
3682  const float rust_resist_mult = 1.0f + enchantment_cache->get_value_multiply(
3683  enchant_vals::mod::SKILL_RUST_RESIST );
3684  if( skill_level_obj.rust( rust_resist, rust_resist_mult ) ) {
3685  mod_power_level( -bio_memory->power_trigger );
3686  }
3687  }
3688 }
3689 
3690 int Character::focus_equilibrium_sleepiness_cap( int equilibrium ) const
3691 {
3692  if( get_sleepiness() >= sleepiness_levels::MASSIVE_SLEEPINESS && equilibrium > 20 ) {
3693  return 20;
3694  } else if( get_sleepiness() >= sleepiness_levels::EXHAUSTED && equilibrium > 40 ) {
3695  return 40;
3696  } else if( get_sleepiness() >= sleepiness_levels::DEAD_TIRED && equilibrium > 60 ) {
3697  return 60;
3698  } else if( get_sleepiness() >= sleepiness_levels::TIRED && equilibrium > 80 ) {
3699  return 80;
3700  }
3701  return equilibrium;
3702 }
3703 
3704 int Character::calc_focus_equilibrium( bool ignore_pain ) const
3705 {
3706  int focus_equilibrium = 100;
3707 
3708  if( activity.id() == ACT_READ ) {
3709  const item_location book = activity.targets[0];
3710  if( book && book->is_book() ) {
3711  const cata::value_ptr<islot_book> &bt = book->type->book;
3712  // apply a penalty when we're actually learning something
3713  const SkillLevel &skill_level = get_skill_level_object( bt->skill );
3714  if( skill_level.can_train() && skill_level < bt->level ) {
3715  focus_equilibrium -= 50;
3716  }
3717  }
3718  }
3719 
3720  int eff_morale = get_morale_level();
3721  // Factor in perceived pain, since it's harder to rest your mind while your body hurts.
3722  // Cenobites don't mind, though
3723  if( !ignore_pain && !has_trait( trait_CENOBITE ) ) {
3724  int perceived_pain = get_perceived_pain();
3725  if( has_trait( trait_MASOCHIST ) ) {
3726  if( perceived_pain > 20 ) {
3727  eff_morale = eff_morale - ( perceived_pain - 20 );
3728  }
3729  } else {
3730  eff_morale = eff_morale - perceived_pain;
3731  }
3732  }
3733 
3734  if( eff_morale < -99 ) {
3735  // At very low morale, focus is at it's minimum
3736  focus_equilibrium = 1;
3737  } else if( eff_morale <= 50 ) {
3738  // At -99 to +50 morale, each point of morale gives or takes 1 point of focus
3739  focus_equilibrium += eff_morale;
3740  } else {
3741  /* Above 50 morale, we apply strong diminishing returns.
3742  * Each block of 50 takes twice as many morale points as the previous one:
3743  * 150 focus at 50 morale (as before)
3744  * 200 focus at 150 morale (100 more morale)
3745  * 250 focus at 350 morale (200 more morale)
3746  * ...
3747  * Cap out at 400% focus gain with 3,150+ morale, mostly as a sanity check.
3748  */
3749 
3750  int block_multiplier = 1;
3751  int morale_left = eff_morale;
3752  while( focus_equilibrium < 400 ) {
3753  if( morale_left > 50 * block_multiplier ) {
3754  // We can afford the entire block. Get it and continue.
3755  morale_left -= 50 * block_multiplier;
3756  focus_equilibrium += 50;
3757  block_multiplier *= 2;
3758  } else {
3759  // We can't afford the entire block. Each block_multiplier morale
3760  // points give 1 focus, and then we're done.
3761  focus_equilibrium += morale_left / block_multiplier;
3762  break;
3763  }
3764  }
3765  }
3766 
3767  // This should be redundant, but just in case...
3768  if( focus_equilibrium < 1 ) {
3769  focus_equilibrium = 1;
3770  } else if( focus_equilibrium > 400 ) {
3771  focus_equilibrium = 400;
3772  }
3773  return focus_equilibrium;
3774 }
3775 
3776 int Character::calc_focus_change() const
3777 {
3778  return focus_equilibrium_sleepiness_cap( calc_focus_equilibrium() ) - get_focus();
3779 }
3780 
3781 void Character::update_mental_focus()
3782 {
3783  // calc_focus_change() returns percentile focus, applying it directly
3784  // to focus pool is an implicit / 100.
3785  focus_pool += 10 * calc_focus_change();
3786 }
3787 
3788 void Character::reset_stats()
3789 {
3790  if( calendar::once_every( 1_minutes ) ) {
3791  update_mental_focus();
3792  }
3793 
3794  mod_dodge_bonus( enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::DODGE_CHANCE, 0 ) );
3795 
3796  /** @EFFECT_STR_MAX above 15 decreases Dodge bonus by 1 (NEGATIVE) */
3797  if( str_max >= 16 ) {
3798  mod_dodge_bonus( -1 ); // Penalty if we're huge
3799  }
3800  /** @EFFECT_STR_MAX below 6 increases Dodge bonus by 1 */
3801  else if( str_max <= 5 ) {
3802  mod_dodge_bonus( 1 ); // Bonus if we're small
3803  }
3804 
3805  apply_skill_boost();
3806 
3807  nv_cached = false;
3808 
3809  // Reset our stats to normal levels
3810  // Any persistent buffs/debuffs will take place in effects,
3811  // player::suffer(), etc.
3812 
3813  // repopulate the stat fields
3814  str_cur = str_max + get_str_bonus();
3815  dex_cur = dex_max + get_dex_bonus();
3816  per_cur = per_max + get_per_bonus();
3817  int_cur = int_max + get_int_bonus();
3818 
3819  // Floor for our stats. No stat changes should occur after this!
3820  if( dex_cur < 0 ) {
3821  dex_cur = 0;
3822  }
3823  if( str_cur < 0 ) {
3824  str_cur = 0;
3825  }
3826  if( per_cur < 0 ) {
3827  per_cur = 0;
3828  }
3829  if( int_cur < 0 ) {
3830  int_cur = 0;
3831  }
3832 }
3833 
3834 void Character::reset()
3835 {
3836  // TODO: Move reset_stats here, remove it from Creature
3837  reset_bonuses();
3838  // Apply bonuses from hardcoded effects
3839  mod_str_bonus( str_bonus_hardcoded );
3840  mod_dex_bonus( dex_bonus_hardcoded );
3841  mod_int_bonus( int_bonus_hardcoded );
3842  mod_per_bonus( per_bonus_hardcoded );
3843  reset_stats();
3844 }
3845 
3846 bool Character::has_nv()
3847 {
3848  static bool nv = false;
3849 
3850  if( !nv_cached ) {
3851  nv_cached = true;
3852  nv = ( worn_with_flag( flag_GNV_EFFECT ) ||
3853  has_flag( json_flag_NIGHT_VISION ) );
3854  }
3855 
3856  return nv;
3857 }
3858 
3859 void Character::calc_discomfort()
3860 {
3861  // clear all instances of discomfort
3862  remove_effect( effect_chafing );
3863  for( const bodypart_id &bp : worn.where_discomfort( *this ) ) {
3864  if( bp->feels_discomfort ) {
3865  add_effect( effect_chafing, 1_turns, bp, true, 1 );
3866  }
3867  }
3868 }
3869 
3870 void Character::calc_encumbrance()
3871 {
3872  calc_encumbrance( item() );
3873 }
3874 
3875 void Character::calc_encumbrance( const item &new_item )
3876 {
3877 
3878  std::map<bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> enc;
3879  worn.item_encumb( enc, new_item, *this );
3880  mut_cbm_encumb( enc );
3881  calc_bmi_encumb( enc );
3882 
3883  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> &elem : enc ) {
3884  set_part_encumbrance_data( elem.first, elem.second );
3885  }
3886 
3887 }
3888 
3889 units::mass Character::get_weight() const
3890 {
3891  units::mass ret = 0_gram;
3892  units::mass wornWeight = worn.weight();
3893 
3894  ret += bodyweight(); // The base weight of the player's body
3895  ret += inv->weight(); // Weight of the stored inventory
3896  ret += wornWeight; // Weight of worn items
3897  ret += weapon.weight(); // Weight of wielded item
3898  ret += bionics_weight(); // Weight of installed bionics
3899  return ret;
3900 }
3901 
3902 std::pair<int, int> Character::climate_control_strength() const
3903 {
3904  // In warmth points
3905  const int DEFAULT_STRENGTH = 50;
3906 
3907  int power_heat = enchantment_cache->get_value_add( enchant_vals::mod::CLIMATE_CONTROL_HEAT );
3908  int power_chill = enchantment_cache->get_value_add( enchant_vals::mod::CLIMATE_CONTROL_CHILL );
3909 
3910  map &here = get_map();
3911  if( has_trait( trait_M_SKIN3 ) && here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FUNGUS, pos() ) &&
3912  in_sleep_state() ) {
3913  power_heat += DEFAULT_STRENGTH;
3914  power_chill += DEFAULT_STRENGTH;
3915  }
3916 
3917  bool regulated_area = false;
3918  if( calendar::turn >= next_climate_control_check ) {
3919  // save CPU and simulate acclimation.
3920  next_climate_control_check = calendar::turn + 20_turns;
3921  if( const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( pos() ) ) {
3922  // TODO: (?) Force player to scrounge together an AC unit
3923  regulated_area = (
3924  (
3925  vp->is_inside() && // Already checks for opened doors
3926  vp->vehicle().engine_on &&
3927  vp->vehicle().has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) &&
3928  vp->vehicle().has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_animal, true )
3929  ) ||
3930  // Also check for a working alternator. Muscle or animal could be powering it.
3931  (
3932  vp->is_inside() &&
3933  vp->vehicle().total_alternator_epower() > 0_W
3934  )
3935  );
3936  }
3937  // TODO: AC check for when building power is implemented
3938  last_climate_control_ret = regulated_area;
3939  if( !regulated_area ) {
3940  // Takes longer to cool down / warm up with AC, than it does to step outside and feel cruddy.
3941  next_climate_control_check += 40_turns;
3942  }
3943  } else {
3944  regulated_area = last_climate_control_ret;
3945  }
3946 
3947  if( regulated_area ) {
3948  power_heat += DEFAULT_STRENGTH;
3949  power_chill += DEFAULT_STRENGTH;
3950  }
3951 
3952  return { power_heat, power_chill };
3953 }
3954 
3955 std::map<bodypart_id, int> Character::get_wind_resistance( const std::map <bodypart_id,
3956  std::vector<const item *>> &clothing_map ) const
3957 {
3958 
3959  std::map<bodypart_id, int> ret;
3960  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
3961  ret.emplace( bp, 0 );
3962  }
3963  bool in_shell = has_active_mutation( trait_SHELL2 ) ||
3964  has_active_mutation( trait_SHELL3 );
3965  // Your shell provides complete wind protection if you're inside it
3966  if( in_shell ) { // NOLINT(bugprone-branch-clone)
3967  for( std::pair<const bodypart_id, int> &this_bp : ret ) {
3968  this_bp.second = 100;
3969  }
3970  return ret;
3971  }
3972 
3973  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_id, std::vector<const item *>> &on_bp : clothing_map ) {
3974  const bodypart_id &bp = on_bp.first;
3975 
3976  int coverage = 0;
3977  float totalExposed = 1.0f;
3978  int penalty = 100;
3979 
3980  for( const item *it : on_bp.second ) {
3981  const item &i = *it;
3982  penalty = 100 - i.wind_resist();
3983  coverage = std::max( 0, i.get_coverage( bp ) - penalty );
3984  totalExposed *= ( 1.0 - coverage / 100.0 ); // Coverage is between 0 and 1?
3985  }
3986 
3987  ret[bp] = 100 - totalExposed * 100;
3988  }
3989 
3990  return ret;
3991 }
3992 
3993 void layer_details::reset()
3994 {
3995  *this = layer_details();
3996 }
3997 
3998 // The stacking penalty applies by doubling the encumbrance of
3999 // each item except the highest encumbrance one.
4000 // So we add them together and then subtract out the highest.
4001 int layer_details::layer( const int encumbrance, bool conflicts )
4002 {
4003  /*
4004  * We should only get to this point with an encumbrance value of 0
4005  * if the item is 'semitangible'. A normal item has a minimum of
4006  * 2 encumbrance for layer penalty purposes.
4007  * ( even if normally its encumbrance is 0 )
4008  */
4009  if( encumbrance == 0 ) {
4010  return total; // skip over the other logic because this item doesn't count
4011  }
4012 
4013  // if this layer has conflicting pieces then add that information
4014  if( conflicts ) {
4015  is_conflicting = true;
4016  }
4017 
4018  pieces.push_back( encumbrance );
4019 
4020  int current = total;
4021  if( encumbrance > max ) {
4022  total += max; // *now* the old max is counted, just ignore the new max
4023  max = encumbrance;
4024  } else {
4025  total += encumbrance;
4026  }
4027  return total - current;
4028 }
4029 
4030 int Character::avg_encumb_of_limb_type( body_part_type::type part_type ) const
4031 {
4032  float limb_encumb = 0.0f;
4033  int num_limbs = 0;
4034  for( const bodypart_id &part : get_all_body_parts_of_type( part_type,
4035  get_body_part_flags::primary_type ) ) {
4036  limb_encumb += encumb( part );
4037  num_limbs++;
4038  }
4039  if( num_limbs == 0 ) {
4040  return 0;
4041  }
4042  limb_encumb /= num_limbs;
4043  return std::round( limb_encumb );
4044 }
4045 
4046 int Character::encumb( const bodypart_id &bp ) const
4047 {
4048  if( !has_part( bp, body_part_filter::equivalent ) ) {
4049  debugmsg( "INFO: Tried to check encumbrance of a bodypart that does not exist." );
4050  return 0;
4051  }
4052  return get_part_encumbrance_data( bp ).encumbrance;
4053 }
4054 
4055 void Character::apply_mut_encumbrance( std::map<bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> &vals ) const
4056 {
4057  const std::vector<trait_id> all_muts = get_mutations();
4058  std::map<bodypart_str_id, float> total_enc;
4059 
4060  // Lower penalty for bps covered only by XL or unrestricted armor
4061  // Initialized on demand for performance reasons:
4062  // (calculation is costly, most of players and npcs are don't have encumbering mutations)
4063 
4064  for( const trait_id &mut : all_muts ) {
4065  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, int> &enc : mut->encumbrance_always ) {
4066  total_enc[enc.first] += enc.second;
4067  }
4068  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, int> &enc : mut->encumbrance_covered ) {
4069  if( wearing_fitting_on( enc.first ) ) {
4070  total_enc[enc.first] += enc.second;
4071  }
4072  }
4073  }
4074 
4075  for( const trait_id &mut : all_muts ) {
4076  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, float> &enc : mut->encumbrance_multiplier_always ) {
4077  total_enc[enc.first] *= enc.second;
4078  }
4079  }
4080 
4081  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, float> &enc : total_enc ) {
4082  vals[enc.first.id()].encumbrance += enc.second;
4083  }
4084 }
4085 
4086 void Character::mut_cbm_encumb( std::map<bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> &vals ) const
4087 {
4088 
4089  for( const bionic_id &bid : get_bionics() ) {
4090  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, int> &element : bid->encumbrance ) {
4091  vals[element.first.id()].encumbrance += element.second;
4092  }
4093  }
4094 
4095  if( has_active_bionic( bio_shock_absorber ) ) {
4096  for( std::pair<const bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> &val : vals ) {
4097  val.second.encumbrance += 3; // Slight encumbrance to all parts except eyes
4098  }
4099  vals[body_part_eyes].encumbrance -= 3;
4100  }
4101 
4102  apply_mut_encumbrance( vals );
4103 }
4104 
4105 void Character::calc_bmi_encumb( std::map<bodypart_id, encumbrance_data> &vals ) const
4106 {
4107  for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
4108  int penalty = std::floor( elem.second.get_bmi_encumbrance_scalar() * std::max( 0.0f,
4109  get_bmi_fat() - static_cast<float>( elem.second.get_bmi_encumbrance_threshold() ) ) );
4110  vals[elem.first.id()].encumbrance += penalty;
4111  }
4112 }
4113 
4114 body_part_set Character::exclusive_flag_coverage( const flag_id &flag ) const
4115 {
4116  body_part_set ret;
4117  ret.fill( get_all_body_parts() );
4118  return worn.exclusive_flag_coverage( ret, flag );
4119 }
4120 
4121 /*
4122  * Innate stats getters
4123  */
4124 
4125 // get_stat() always gets total (current) value, NEVER just the base
4126 // get_stat_bonus() is always just the bonus amount
4127 int Character::get_str() const
4128 {
4129  return std::max( 0, get_str_base() + str_bonus );
4130 }
4131 int Character::get_dex() const
4132 {
4133  return std::max( 0, get_dex_base() + dex_bonus );
4134 }
4135 int Character::get_per() const
4136 {
4137  return std::max( 0, get_per_base() + per_bonus );
4138 }
4139 int Character::get_int() const
4140 {
4141  return std::max( 0, get_int_base() + int_bonus );
4142 }
4143 
4144 int Character::get_str_base() const
4145 {
4146  return str_max;
4147 }
4148 int Character::get_dex_base() const
4149 {
4150  return dex_max;
4151 }
4152 int Character::get_per_base() const
4153 {
4154  return per_max;
4155 }
4156 int Character::get_int_base() const
4157 {
4158  return int_max;
4159 }
4160 
4161 int Character::get_str_bonus() const
4162 {
4163  return str_bonus;
4164 }
4165 int Character::get_dex_bonus() const
4166 {
4167  return dex_bonus;
4168 }
4169 int Character::get_per_bonus() const
4170 {
4171  return per_bonus;
4172 }
4173 int Character::get_int_bonus() const
4174 {
4175  return int_bonus;
4176 }
4177 
4178 static int get_speedydex_bonus( const int dex )
4179 {
4180  static const std::string speedydex_min_dex( "SPEEDYDEX_MIN_DEX" );
4181  static const std::string speedydex_dex_speed( "SPEEDYDEX_DEX_SPEED" );
4182  // this is the number to be multiplied by the increment
4183  const int modified_dex = std::max( dex - get_option<int>( speedydex_min_dex ), 0 );
4184  return modified_dex * get_option<int>( speedydex_dex_speed );
4185 }
4186 
4187 int Character::get_enchantment_speed_bonus() const
4188 {
4189  return enchantment_speed_bonus;
4190 }
4191 
4192 int Character::get_speed() const
4193 {
4194  if( has_flag( json_flag_STEADY ) ) {
4195  return get_speed_base() + std::max( 0, get_speed_bonus() );
4196  }
4197  return Creature::get_speed();
4198 }
4199 
4200 int Character::get_arm_str() const
4201 {
4202  return str_cur * get_modifier( character_modifier_limb_str_mod );
4203 }
4204 
4205 int Character::get_eff_per() const
4206 {
4207  return ( Character::get_per() + int( Character::has_proficiency(
4208  proficiency_prof_spotting ) ) *
4209  Character::get_per_base() ) * get_limb_score( limb_score_vision ) ;
4210 }
4211 
4212 int Character::ranged_dex_mod() const
4213 {
4214  ///\EFFECT_DEX <20 increases ranged penalty
4215  return std::max( ( 20.0 - get_dex() ) * 0.5, 0.0 );
4216 }
4217 
4218 int Character::ranged_per_mod() const
4219 {
4220  ///\EFFECT_PER <20 increases ranged aiming penalty.
4221  return std::max( ( 20.0 - get_per() ) * 1.2, 0.0 );
4222 }
4223 
4224 int Character::get_lifestyle() const
4225 {
4226  // gets your health_tally variable + the factor of your bmi on your healthiness.
4227 
4228  // being over or underweight makes your "effective healthiness" lower.
4229  // for example, you have a lifestyle of 0 and a bmi_fat of 15 (border between obese and very obese)
4230  // 0 - 25 - 0 = -25. So your "effective lifestyle" is -25 (feel a little cruddy)
4231  // ex2 you have a lifestyle of 50 and a bmi_fat of 15 because you get exercise and eat well
4232  // 50 - 25 - 0 = 25. So your "effective lifestyle" is 25 (feel decent despite being obese)
4233  // ex3 you have a lifestyle of -50 and a bmi_fat of 15 because you eat candy and don't exercise
4234  // -50 - 25 - 0 = -75. So your "effective lifestyle" is -75 (you'd feel crappy normally but because of your weight you feel worse)
4235 
4236  const float bmi = get_bmi_fat();
4237  int over_factor = std::round( std::max( 0.0f,
4238  5 * ( bmi - character_weight_category::obese ) ) );
4239  int under_factor = std::round( std::max( 0.0f,
4240  50 * ( character_weight_category::normal - bmi ) ) );
4241  return std::max( lifestyle - ( over_factor + under_factor ), -200 );
4242 }
4243 
4244 int Character::get_daily_health() const
4245 {
4246  return daily_health;
4247 }
4248 
4249 int Character::get_health_tally() const
4250 {
4251  return health_tally;
4252 }
4253 
4254 /*
4255  * Innate stats setters
4256  */
4257 
4258 void Character::set_str_bonus( int nstr )
4259 {
4260  str_bonus = nstr;
4261  str_cur = std::max( 0, str_max + str_bonus );
4262 }
4263 void Character::set_dex_bonus( int ndex )
4264 {
4265  dex_bonus = ndex;
4266  dex_cur = std::max( 0, dex_max + dex_bonus );
4267 }
4268 void Character::set_per_bonus( int nper )
4269 {
4270  per_bonus = nper;
4271  per_cur = std::max( 0, per_max + per_bonus );
4272 }
4273 void Character::set_int_bonus( int nint )
4274 {
4275  int_bonus = nint;
4276  int_cur = std::max( 0, int_max + int_bonus );
4277 }
4278 void Character::mod_str_bonus( int nstr )
4279 {
4280  str_bonus += nstr;
4281  str_cur = std::max( 0, str_max + str_bonus );
4282 }
4283 void Character::mod_dex_bonus( int ndex )
4284 {
4285  dex_bonus += ndex;
4286  dex_cur = std::max( 0, dex_max + dex_bonus );
4287 }
4288 void Character::mod_per_bonus( int nper )
4289 {
4290  per_bonus += nper;
4291  per_cur = std::max( 0, per_max + per_bonus );
4292 }
4293 void Character::mod_int_bonus( int nint )
4294 {
4295  int_bonus += nint;
4296  int_cur = std::max( 0, int_max + int_bonus );
4297 }
4298 
4299 namespace io
4300 {
4301 template<>
4302 std::string enum_to_string<character_stat>( character_stat data )
4303 {
4304  switch( data ) {
4305  // *INDENT-OFF*
4306  case character_stat::STRENGTH: return "STR";
4307  case character_stat::DEXTERITY: return "DEX";
4308  case character_stat::INTELLIGENCE: return "INT";
4309  case character_stat::PERCEPTION: return "PER";
4310 
4311  // *INDENT-ON*
4312  case character_stat::DUMMY_STAT:
4313  break;
4314  }
4315  cata_fatal( "Invalid character_stat" );
4316 }
4317 } // namespace io
4318 
4319 void Character::set_lifestyle( int nhealthy )
4320 {
4321  lifestyle = nhealthy;
4322 }
4323 void Character::mod_livestyle( int nhealthy )
4324 {
4325  lifestyle += enchantment_cache->modify_value( enchant_vals::mod::HEALTHY_RATE, nhealthy );
4326  // Clamp lifestyle between [-200, 200]
4327  lifestyle = std::max( lifestyle, -200 );
4328  lifestyle = std::min( lifestyle, 200 );
4329 }
4330 void Character::set_daily_health( int nhealthy_mod )
4331 {
4332  daily_health = nhealthy_mod;
4333 }
4334 void Character::mod_daily_health( int nhealthy_mod, int cap )
4335 {
4336  // TODO: This really should be a full morale-like system, with per-effect caps
4337  // and durations. This version prevents any single effect from exceeding its
4338  // intended ceiling, but multiple effects will overlap instead of adding.
4339 
4340  // Cap indicates how far the mod is allowed to shift in this direction.
4341  // It can have a different sign to the mod, e.g. for items that treat
4342  // extremely low health, but can't make you healthy.
4343  if( nhealthy_mod == 0 || cap == 0 ) {
4344  return;
4345  }
4346  int low_cap;
4347  int high_cap;
4348  if( nhealthy_mod < 0 ) {
4349  low_cap = cap;
4350  high_cap = 200;
4351  } else {
4352  low_cap = -200;
4353  high_cap = cap;
4354  }
4355 
4356  // If we're already out-of-bounds, we don't need to do anything.
4357  if( ( daily_health <= low_cap && nhealthy_mod < 0 ) ||
4358  ( daily_health >= high_cap && nhealthy_mod > 0 ) ) {
4359  return;
4360  }
4361 
4362  daily_health += nhealthy_mod;
4363 
4364  // Since we already bailed out if we were out-of-bounds, we can
4365  // just clamp to the boundaries here.
4366  daily_health = std::min( daily_health, high_cap );
4367  daily_health = std::max( daily_health, low_cap );
4368 }
4369 
4370 void Character::mod_health_tally( int mod )
4371 {
4372  health_tally += mod;
4373 }
4374 
4375 int Character::get_stored_kcal() const
4376 {
4377  return stored_calories / 1000;
4378 }
4379 
4380 int Character::kcal_speed_penalty() const
4381 {
4382  static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> starv_thresholds = { {
4383  std::make_pair( 0.0f, -90.0f ),
4384  std::make_pair( character_weight_category::emaciated, -50.f ),
4385  std::make_pair( character_weight_category::underweight, -25.0f ),
4386  std::make_pair( character_weight_category::normal, 0.0f )
4387  }
4388  };
4389  if( get_kcal_percent() > 0.95f ) {
4390  return 0;
4391  } else {
4392  return std::round( multi_lerp( starv_thresholds, get_bmi_fat() ) );
4393  }
4394 }
4395 
4396 std::string Character::activity_level_str( float level ) const
4397 {
4398  for( const std::pair<const float, std::string> &member : activity_levels_str_map ) {
4399  if( level <= member.first ) {
4400  return member.second;
4401  }
4402  }
4403  return ( --activity_levels_str_map.end() )->second;
4404 }
4405 
4406 std::string Character::debug_weary_info() const
4407 {
4408  int amt = activity_history.weariness();
4409  std::string max_act = activity_level_str( maximum_exertion_level() );
4410  float move_mult = exertion_adjusted_move_multiplier( EXTRA_EXERCISE );
4411 
4412  int bmr = base_bmr();
4413  std::string weary_internals = activity_history.debug_weary_info();
4414  int cardio_mult = get_cardiofit();
4415  int thresh = weary_threshold();
4416  int current = weariness_level();
4417  int morale = get_morale_level();
4418  int weight = units::to_gram<int>( bodyweight() );
4419  float bmi = get_bmi();
4420 
4421  return string_format( "Weariness: %s Max Full Exert: %s Mult: %g\n BMR: %d CARDIO FITNESS: %d\n %s Thresh: %d At: %d\n Kcal: %d/%d Sleepiness: %d Morale: %d Wgt: %d (BMI %.1f)",
4422  amt, max_act, move_mult, bmr, cardio_mult, weary_internals, thresh, current,
4423  get_stored_kcal(), get_healthy_kcal(), sleepiness, morale, weight, bmi );
4424 }
4425 
4426 void Character::mod_stored_kcal( int nkcal, const bool ignore_weariness )
4427 {
4428  if( needs_food() ) {
4429  mod_stored_calories( nkcal * 1000, ignore_weariness );
4430  }
4431 }
4432 
4433 void Character::mod_stored_calories( int ncal, const bool ignore_weariness )
4434 {
4435  int nkcal = ncal / 1000;
4436  if( nkcal > 0 ) {
4437  add_gained_calories( nkcal );
4438  } else {
4439  add_spent_calories( -nkcal );
4440  }
4441 
4442  if( !ignore_weariness ) {
4443  activity_history.calorie_adjust( ncal );
4444  }
4445  if( ncal < 0 || std::numeric_limits<int>::max() - ncal > stored_calories ) {
4446  set_stored_calories( stored_calories + ncal );
4447  }
4448 }
4449 
4450 void Character::set_stored_kcal( int kcal )
4451 {
4452  set_stored_calories( kcal * 1000 );
4453 }
4454 
4455 void Character::set_stored_calories( int cal )
4456 {
4457  if( stored_calories != cal ) {
4458  int cached_bmi = std::floor( get_bmi_fat() );
4459  stored_calories = cal;
4460 
4461  //some mutant change their max_hp according to their bmi
4462  recalc_hp();
4463  //need to check obesity penalties when this happens if BMI changed
4464  if( std::floor( get_bmi_fat() ) != cached_bmi ) {
4465  calc_encumbrance();
4466  }
4467  }
4468 }
4469 
4470 int Character::get_healthy_kcal() const
4471 {
4472  float healthy_weight = get_cached_organic_size() * 5.0f * std::pow( height() / 100.0f, 2 );
4473  return std::floor( KCAL_PER_KG * healthy_weight );
4474 }
4475 
4476 float Character::get_kcal_percent() const
4477 {
4478  return static_cast<float>( get_stored_kcal() ) / static_cast<float>( get_healthy_kcal() );
4479 }
4480 
4481 int Character::get_hunger() const
4482 {
4483  return hunger;
4484 }
4485 
4486 void Character::mod_hunger( int nhunger )
4487 {
4488  if( needs_food() ) {
4489  set_hunger( hunger + nhunger );
4490  }
4491 }
4492 
4493 void Character::set_hunger( int nhunger )
4494 {
4495  if( hunger != nhunger ) {
4496  // cap hunger at 300, just below famished
4497  hunger = std::min( 300, nhunger );
4498  on_stat_change( "hunger", hunger );
4499  }
4500 }
4501 
4502 // this is a translation from a legacy value
4503 int Character::get_starvation() const
4504 {
4505  static const std::vector<std::pair<float, float>> starv_thresholds = { {
4506  std::make_pair( 0.0f, 6000.0f ),
4507  std::make_pair( 0.8f, 300.0f ),
4508  std::make_pair( 0.95f, 100.0f )
4509  }
4510  };
4511  if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.95f ) {
4512  return std::round( multi_lerp( starv_thresholds, get_kcal_percent() ) );
4513  }
4514  return 0;
4515 }
4516 
4517 int Character::get_thirst() const
4518 {
4519  return thirst;
4520 }
4521 
4522 int Character::get_instant_thirst() const
4523 {
4524  return thirst - std::max( units::to_milliliter<int>
4525  ( stomach.get_water() / 10 ), 0 );
4526 }
4527 
4528 void Character::mod_thirst( int nthirst )
4529 {
4530  if( has_flag( json_flag_NO_THIRST ) || !needs_food() ) {
4531  return;
4532  }
4533  set_thirst( std::max( -100, thirst + nthirst ) );
4534 }
4535 
4536 void Character::set_thirst( int nthirst )
4537 {
4538  if( thirst != nthirst ) {
4539  thirst = nthirst;
4540  on_stat_change( "thirst", thirst );
4541  }
4542 }

4544 void Character::mod_sleepiness( int nsleepiness )
4545 {

4547 }
4548 
4549 void Character::mod_sleep_deprivation( int nsleep_deprivation )
4550 {
4551  set_sleep_deprivation( sleep_deprivation + nsleep_deprivation );
4552 }
4553 
4554 void Character::set_sleepiness( int nsleepiness )
4555 {
4556  nsleepiness = std::max( nsleepiness, -1000 );
4557  if( sleepiness != nsleepiness ) {
4558  sleepiness = nsleepiness;
4559  on_stat_change( "sleepiness", sleepiness );
4560  }
4561 }
4562 
4563 void Character::set_sleepiness( sleepiness_levels nsleepiness )
4564 {
4565  set_sleepiness( static_cast<int>( nsleepiness ) );
4566 }
4567 
4568 void Character::set_sleep_deprivation( int nsleep_deprivation )
4569 {
4570  sleep_deprivation = std::min( static_cast< int >( SLEEP_DEPRIVATION_MASSIVE ), std::max( 0,
4571  nsleep_deprivation ) );
4572 }

4613 
4614 bool Character::is_deaf() const
4615 {
4616  return get_effect_int( effect_deaf ) > 2 || worn_with_flag( flag_DEAF ) ||
4617  has_flag( json_flag_DEAF ) || has_effect( effect_narcosis ) ||
4618  ( has_trait( trait_M_SKIN3 ) && get_map().has_flag_ter_or_furn( ter_furn_flag::TFLAG_FUNGUS, pos() )
4619  && in_sleep_state() );
4620 }
4621 
4622 bool Character::is_mute() const
4623 {
4624  return get_effect_int( effect_mute ) || worn_with_flag( flag_MUTE ) ||
4625  ( has_trait( trait_PROF_FOODP ) && !( is_wearing( itype_foodperson_mask ) ||
4626  is_wearing( itype_foodperson_mask_on ) ) ) ||
4627  has_trait( trait_MUTE );
4628 }
4629 
4630 void Character::on_damage_of_type( const effect_source &source, int adjusted_damage,
4631  const damage_type_id &dt, const bodypart_id &bp )
4632 {
4633  // Handle bp onhit effects
4634  bodypart *body_part = get_part( bp );
4635  const bool is_minor = bp->main_part != bp->id;
4636  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER, "Targeting limb %s with %d %s type damage", bp->name,
4637  adjusted_damage, dt->name.translated() );
4638  // Damage as a percent of the limb's max hp or raw dmg for minor parts
4639  float dmg_ratio = is_minor ? adjusted_damage : 100 * adjusted_damage / body_part->get_hp_max();
4640  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER, "Main BP max hp %d, damage ratio %.1f",
4641  body_part->get_hp_max(), dmg_ratio );
4642  for( const bp_onhit_effect &eff : body_part->get_onhit_effects( dt ) ) {
4643  if( dmg_ratio >= eff.dmg_threshold ) {
4644  float scaling = ( dmg_ratio - eff.dmg_threshold ) / eff.scale_increment;
4645  int scaled_chance = roll_remainder( std::max( static_cast<float>( eff.chance ),
4646  eff.chance + eff.chance_dmg_scaling * scaling ) );
4647  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER, "Scaling factor %.1f, base chance %d%%, scaled chance %d%%",
4648  scaling, eff.chance, scaled_chance );
4649  if( x_in_y( scaled_chance, 100 ) ) {
4650 
4651  // Scale based on damage done
4652  int scaled_dur = roll_remainder( std::max( static_cast<float>( eff.duration ),
4653  eff.duration + eff.duration_dmg_scaling * scaling ) );
4654  int scaled_int = roll_remainder( std::max( static_cast<float>( eff.intensity ),
4655  eff.intensity + eff.intensity_dmg_scaling * scaling ) );
4656 
4657  // go through all effects. if they modify effect duration, scale dur accordingly.
4658  // obviously inefficient, but probably fast enough since this only is calculated once per attack.
4659  float eff_scale = 1.0f;
4660  for( const effect &e : get_effects() ) {
4661  for( const effect_dur_mod &eff_dur_mod : e.get_effect_dur_scaling() ) {
4662  // debugmsg( "Checking effect %s, with same_bp, modifier %f", eff.id.c_str(), eff_dur_mod.modifier);
4663  if( eff_dur_mod.effect_id == eff.id ) {
4664  if( eff_dur_mod.same_bp ) {
4665  if( e.get_bp() != body_part->get_id() ) {
4666  continue;
4667  }
4668  }
4669  eff_scale *= eff_dur_mod.modifier;
4670  }
4671  }
4672  }
4673 
4674  scaled_dur = static_cast<int>( scaled_dur * eff_scale );
4675 
4676  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER,
4677  "Atempting to add effect %s, scaled duration %d turns, scaled intensity %d, effect scaling %f",
4678  eff.id.c_str(),
4679  scaled_dur,
4680  scaled_int,
4681  eff_scale );
4682 
4683  // Handle intensity/duration clamping
4684  if( eff.max_intensity != INT_MAX ) {
4685  int prev_int = get_effect( eff.id, bp ).get_intensity();
4686  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER,
4687  "Max intensity %d, current intensity %d", eff.max_intensity, prev_int );
4688  if( ( prev_int + scaled_int ) > eff.max_intensity ) {
4689  scaled_int = eff.max_intensity - prev_int;
4690  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER,
4691  "Limiting added intensity to %d", scaled_int );
4692  }
4693  }
4694  if( eff.max_duration != INT_MAX ) {
4695  int prev_dur = to_turns<int>( get_effect( eff.id, bp ).get_duration() );
4696  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER,
4697  "Max duration %d, current duration %d", eff.max_duration, prev_dur );
4698  if( ( prev_dur + scaled_dur ) > eff.max_duration ) {
4699  scaled_dur = eff.max_duration - prev_dur;
4700  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHARACTER,
4701  "Limiting added duration to %d seconds", scaled_dur );
4702  }
4703  }
4704  // Add the effect globally if defined
4705  add_effect( source, eff.id, 1_turns * scaled_dur, eff.global ? bodypart_str_id::NULL_ID() : bp,
4706  false, scaled_int );
4707  }
4708  }
4709  }
4710  // Electrical damage has a chance to temporarily incapacitate bionics in the damaged body_part.
4711  if( dt == damage_electric ) {
4712  const time_duration min_disable_time = 10_turns * adjusted_damage;
4713  for( bionic &i : *my_bionics ) {
4714  if( !i.powered ) {
4715  // Unpowered bionics are protected from power surges.
4716  continue;
4717  }
4718  const bionic_data &info = i.info();
4719  if( info.has_flag( STATIC( json_character_flag( "BIONIC_SHOCKPROOF" ) ) ) ||
4720  info.has_flag( STATIC( json_character_flag( "BIONIC_FAULTY" ) ) ) ) {
4721  continue;
4722  }
4723  const std::map<bodypart_str_id, size_t> &bodyparts = info.occupied_bodyparts;
4724  if( bodyparts.find( bp.id() ) != bodyparts.end() ) {
4725  const int bp_hp = get_part_hp_cur( bp );
4726  // The chance to incapacitate is as high as 50% if the attack deals damage equal to one third of the body part's current health.
4727  if( x_in_y( adjusted_damage * 3, bp_hp ) && one_in( 2 ) ) {
4728  if( i.incapacitated_time == 0_turns ) {
4729  add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Your %s bionic shorts out!" ), info.name );
4730  }
4731  i.incapacitated_time += rng( min_disable_time, 10 * min_disable_time );
4732  }
4733  }
4734  }
4735  }
4736 }
4737 
4738 void Character::reset_bonuses()
4739 {
4740  // Reset all bonuses to 0 and multipliers to 1.0
4741  str_bonus = 0;
4742  dex_bonus = 0;
4743  per_bonus = 0;
4744  int_bonus = 0;
4745 
4746  Creature::reset_bonuses();
4747 }
4748 
4749 int Character::get_max_healthy() const
4750 {
4751  const float bmi = get_bmi_fat();
4752  int over_factor = std::round( std::max( 0.0f,
4753  25 * ( bmi - character_weight_category::overweight ) ) );
4754  int under_factor = std::round( std::max( 0.0f,
4755  200 * ( character_weight_category::normal - bmi ) ) );
4756  return std::max( 200 - over_factor - under_factor, -200 );
4757 }
4758 
4759 void Character::regen( int rate_multiplier )
4760 {
4761  int pain_ticks = std::max( 1, roll_remainder( enchantment_cache->modify_value(
4762  enchant_vals::mod::PAIN_REMOVE, rate_multiplier ) ) );
4763  while( get_pain() > 0 && pain_ticks-- > 0 ) {
4764  mod_pain( -roll_remainder( 0.2f + get_pain() / 50.0f ) );
4765  }
4766 
4767  float rest = rest_quality();
4768  float heal_rate = healing_rate( rest ) * to_turns<int>( 5_minutes );
4769  if( heal_rate > 0.0f ) {
4770  healall( roll_remainder( rate_multiplier * heal_rate ) );
4771  } else if( heal_rate < 0.0f ) {
4772  int rot_rate = roll_remainder( rate_multiplier * -heal_rate );
4773  // Has to be in loop because some effects depend on rounding
4774  while( rot_rate-- > 0 ) {
4775  hurtall( 1, nullptr, false );
4776  }
4777  }
4778 
4779  // include healing effects
4780  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts( get_body_part_flags::only_main ) ) {
4781  float healing = healing_rate_medicine( rest, bp ) * to_turns<int>( 5_minutes );
4782  int healing_apply = roll_remainder( healing );
4783  mod_part_healed_total( bp, healing_apply );
4784  heal( bp, healing_apply );
4785  if( get_part_damage_bandaged( bp ) > 0 ) {
4786  mod_part_damage_bandaged( bp, -healing_apply );
4787  if( get_part_damage_bandaged( bp ) <= 0 ) {
4788  set_part_damage_bandaged( bp, 0 );
4789  remove_effect( effect_bandaged, bp );
4790  add_msg_if_player( _( "Bandaged wounds on your %s healed." ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4791  }
4792  }
4793  if( get_part_damage_disinfected( bp ) > 0 ) {
4794  mod_part_damage_disinfected( bp, -healing_apply );
4795  if( get_part_damage_disinfected( bp ) <= 0 ) {
4796  set_part_damage_disinfected( bp, 0 );
4797  remove_effect( effect_disinfected, bp );
4798  add_msg_if_player( _( "Disinfected wounds on your %s healed." ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4799  }
4800  }
4801 
4802  // remove effects if the limb was healed by other way
4803  if( has_effect( effect_bandaged, bp.id() ) && is_part_at_max_hp( bp ) ) {
4804  set_part_damage_bandaged( bp, 0 );
4805  remove_effect( effect_bandaged, bp );
4806  add_msg_if_player( _( "Bandaged wounds on your %s healed." ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4807  }
4808  if( has_effect( effect_disinfected, bp.id() ) && is_part_at_max_hp( bp ) ) {
4809  set_part_damage_disinfected( bp, 0 );
4810  remove_effect( effect_disinfected, bp );
4811  add_msg_if_player( _( "Disinfected wounds on your %s healed." ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4812  }
4813  }
4814 
4815  if( get_rad() > 0 ) {
4816  mod_rad( -roll_remainder( rate_multiplier / 50.0f ) );
4817  }
4818 }
4819 
4820 void Character::update_health()
4821 {
4822  // Limit daily_health to [-200, 200].
4823  // This also sets approximate bounds for the character's health.
4824  if( get_daily_health() > 200 ) {
4825  set_daily_health( 200 );
4826  } else if( get_daily_health() < -200 ) {
4827  set_daily_health( -200 );
4828  }
4829 
4830  // Active leukocyte breeder will keep your mean health_tally near 100
4831  int effective_daily_health = enchantment_cache->modify_value(
4832  enchant_vals::mod::EFFECTIVE_HEALTH_MOD, 0 );
4833  if( effective_daily_health == 0 ) {
4834  effective_daily_health = get_daily_health();
4835  }
4836 
4837  if( calendar::once_every( 1_days ) ) {
4838  mod_health_tally( effective_daily_health );
4839  int mean_daily_health = get_health_tally() / 7;
4840  mod_livestyle( mean_daily_health );
4841  mod_health_tally( -mean_daily_health );
4842  set_daily_health( 0 );
4843  }
4844  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_CHAR_HEALTH, "Lifestyle: %d, Daily health: %d", get_lifestyle(),
4845  get_daily_health() );
4846 }
4847 
4848 int Character::weariness() const
4849 {
4850  return activity_history.weariness();
4851 }
4852 
4853 int Character::weary_threshold() const
4854 {
4855  const int bmr = base_bmr();
4856  int threshold = bmr * get_option<float>( "WEARY_BMR_MULT" );
4857  // reduce by 1% per 14 points of sleepiness after 150 points
4858  threshold *= 1.0f - ( ( std::max( sleepiness, -20 ) - 150 ) / 1400.0f );
4859  // Each 2 points of morale increase or decrease by 1%
4860  threshold *= 1.0f + ( get_morale_level() / 200.0f );
4861  // TODO: Hunger effects this
4862 
4863  return std::max( threshold, bmr / 10 );
4864 }
4865 
4866 std::pair<int, int> Character::weariness_transition_progress() const
4867 {
4868  // Mostly a duplicate of the below function. No real way to clean this up
4869  int amount = weariness();
4870  int threshold = weary_threshold();
4871  amount -= threshold * get_option<float>( "WEARY_INITIAL_STEP" );
4872  // failsafe if threshold is zero; see #72242
4873  if( threshold == 0 ) {
4874  return { std::abs( amount ), threshold };
4875  } else {
4876  while( amount >= 0 ) {
4877  amount -= threshold;
4878  if( threshold > 20 ) {
4879  threshold *= get_option<float>( "WEARY_THRESH_SCALING" );
4880  }
4881  }
4882  }
4883 
4884  // If we return the absolute value of the amount, it will work better
4885  // Because as it decreases, we will approach a transition
4886  return {std::abs( amount ), threshold};
4887 }
4888 
4889 int Character::weariness_level() const
4890 {
4891  int amount = weariness();
4892  int threshold = weary_threshold();
4893  int level = 0;
4894  amount -= threshold * get_option<float>( "WEARY_INITIAL_STEP" );
4895  // failsafe if threshold is zero; see #72242
4896  if( threshold == 0 ) {
4897  return level;
4898  } else {
4899  while( amount >= 0 ) {
4900  amount -= threshold;
4901  if( threshold > 20 ) {
4902  threshold *= get_option<float>( "WEARY_THRESH_SCALING" );
4903  }
4904  ++level;
4905  }
4906  }
4907 
4908  return level;
4909 }
4910 
4911 
4912 int Character::weariness_transition_level() const
4913 {
4914  int amount = weariness();
4915  int threshold = weary_threshold();
4916  amount -= threshold * get_option<float>( "WEARY_INITIAL_STEP" );
4917  // failsafe if threshold is zero; see #72242
4918  if( threshold == 0 ) {
4919  return std::abs( amount );
4920  } else {
4921  while( amount >= 0 ) {
4922  amount -= threshold;
4923  if( threshold > 20 ) {
4924  threshold *= get_option<float>( "WEARY_THRESH_SCALING" );
4925  }
4926  }
4927  }
4928 
4929  return std::abs( amount );
4930 }
4931 
4932 float Character::maximum_exertion_level() const
4933 {
4934  switch( weariness_level() ) {
4935  case 0:
4936  return EXTRA_EXERCISE;
4937  case 1:
4938  return ACTIVE_EXERCISE;
4939  case 2:
4940  return BRISK_EXERCISE;
4941  case 3:
4942  return MODERATE_EXERCISE;
4943  case 4:
4944  return LIGHT_EXERCISE;
4945  case 5:
4946  default:
4947  return NO_EXERCISE;
4948  }
4949 }
4950 
4951 float Character::exertion_adjusted_move_multiplier( float level ) const
4952 {
4953  // The default value for level is -1.0
4954  // And any values we get that are negative or 0
4955  // will cause incorrect behavior
4956  if( level <= 0 ) {
4957  level = activity_history.activity( in_sleep_state() );
4958  }
4959  const float max = maximum_exertion_level();
4960  if( level < max ) {
4961  return 1.0f;
4962  }
4963  return max / level;
4964 }
4965 
4966 float Character::instantaneous_activity_level() const
4967 {
4968  return activity_history.instantaneous_activity_level();
4969 }
4970 
4971 int Character::activity_level_index() const
4972 {
4973  // Activity levels are 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10
4974  // So we can easily cut them in half and round down for an index
4975  return std::floor( instantaneous_activity_level() / 2 );
4976 }
4977 
4978 float Character::activity_level() const
4979 {
4980  float max = maximum_exertion_level();
4981  float attempted_level = activity_history.activity( in_sleep_state() );
4982  return std::min( max, attempted_level );
4983 }
4984 
4985 bool Character::needs_food() const
4986 {
4987  // Before the mechanism for non-player faction NPCs to obtain food is set up, it is unreasonable to require them to consume food.
4988  return ( !get_option<bool>( "NO_NPC_FOOD" ) && get_faction() == get_avatar().get_faction() ) ||
4989  !is_npc();
4990 }
4991 
4992 void Character::update_needs( int rate_multiplier )
4993 {
4994  const int current_stim = get_stim();
4995  // Hunger, thirst, & sleepiness up every 5 minutes
4996  effect &sleep = get_effect( effect_sleep );
4997  // No food/thirst/sleepiness clock at all
4998  const bool debug_ls = has_trait( trait_DEBUG_LS );
4999  // No food/thirst, capped sleepiness clock (only up to tired)
5000  const bool asleep = !sleep.is_null();
5001  const bool lying = asleep || has_effect( effect_lying_down ) ||
5002  activity.id() == ACT_TRY_SLEEP;
5003 
5004  needs_rates rates = calc_needs_rates();
5005 
5006  const bool wasnt_sleepinessd = get_sleepiness() <= sleepiness_levels::DEAD_TIRED;
5007  // Don't increase sleepiness if sleeping or trying to sleep or if we're at the cap.
5008  if( get_sleepiness() < 1050 && !asleep && !debug_ls ) {
5009  if( rates.sleepiness > 0.0f ) {
5010  int sleepiness_roll = roll_remainder( rates.sleepiness * rate_multiplier );
5011  mod_sleepiness( sleepiness_roll );
5012 
5013  // Synaptic regen bionic stops SD while awake and boosts it while sleeping
5014  if( !has_flag( json_flag_STOP_SLEEP_DEPRIVATION ) ) {
5015  // sleepiness_roll should be around 1 - so the counter increases by 1 every minute on average,
5016  // but characters who need less sleep will also get less sleep deprived, and vice-versa.
5017 
5018  // Note: Since needs are updated in 5-minute increments, we have to multiply the roll again by
5019  // 5. If rate_multiplier is > 1, sleepiness_roll will be higher and this will work out.
5020  mod_sleep_deprivation( sleepiness_roll * 5 );
5021  }
5022 
5023  if( !needs_food() && get_sleepiness() > sleepiness_levels::TIRED ) {
5024  set_sleepiness( sleepiness_levels::TIRED );
5025  set_sleep_deprivation( 0 );
5026  }
5027  }
5028  } else if( asleep ) {
5029  if( rates.recovery > 0.0f ) {
5030  int recovered = roll_remainder( rates.recovery * rate_multiplier );
5031  if( get_sleepiness() - recovered < -20 ) {
5032  // Should be wake up, but that could prevent some retroactive regeneration
5033  sleep.set_duration( 1_turns );
5034  mod_sleepiness( -25 );
5035  } else {
5036  if( has_effect( effect_disrupted_sleep ) || has_effect( effect_recently_coughed ) ) {
5037  recovered *= .5;
5038  }
5039  mod_sleepiness( -recovered );
5040 
5041  // Sleeping on the ground, no bionic = 1x rest_modifier
5042  // Sleeping on a bed, no bionic = 2x rest_modifier
5043  // Sleeping on a comfy bed, no bionic= 3x rest_modifier
5044 
5045  // Sleeping on the ground, bionic = 3x rest_modifier
5046  // Sleeping on a bed, bionic = 6x rest_modifier
5047  // Sleeping on a comfy bed, bionic = 9x rest_modifier
5048  float rest_modifier = ( has_flag( json_flag_STOP_SLEEP_DEPRIVATION ) ? 3 : 1 );
5049  // Melatonin supplements also add a flat bonus to recovery speed
5050  if( has_effect( effect_melatonin ) ) {
5051  rest_modifier += 1;
5052  }
5053 
5054  const comfort_level comfort = base_comfort_value( pos_bub() ).level;
5055 
5056  if( comfort >= comfort_level::very_comfortable ) {
5057  rest_modifier *= 3;
5058  } else if( comfort >= comfort_level::comfortable ) {
5059  rest_modifier *= 2.5;
5060  } else if( comfort >= comfort_level::slightly_comfortable ) {
5061  rest_modifier *= 2;
5062  }
5063 
5064  // If we're just tired, we'll get a decent boost to our sleep quality.
5065  // The opposite is true for very tired characters.
5066  if( get_sleepiness() < sleepiness_levels::DEAD_TIRED ) {
5067  rest_modifier += 2;
5068  } else if( get_sleepiness() >= sleepiness_levels::EXHAUSTED ) {
5069  rest_modifier = ( rest_modifier > 2 ) ? rest_modifier - 2 : 1;
5070  }
5071 
5072  // Recovered is multiplied by 2 as well, since we spend 1/3 of the day sleeping
5073  mod_sleep_deprivation( -rest_modifier * ( recovered * 2 ) );
5074 
5075  }
5076  }
5077  if( calendar::once_every( 10_minutes ) &&
5078  ( has_trait( trait_WATERSLEEP ) || has_trait( trait_UNDINE_SLEEP_WATER ) ) ) {
5079  mod_sleepiness( -3 ); // Fish sleep less in water
5080  }
5081  }
5082  if( is_avatar() && wasnt_sleepinessd && get_sleepiness() > sleepiness_levels::DEAD_TIRED &&
5083  !lying ) {
5084  if( !activity ) {
5085  add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You're feeling tired. %s to lie down for sleep." ),
